snippet: After two weeks of air and artillery strikes during which over 500,000 people fled the area, soldiers moved into a town in North Waziristan.
abstract: Pakistan soldiers fan out across tribal town of Miram Shah in North Waziristan and begin to wrest it from militant control; town has been magnet for jihadists from across region and world and an embarrassment to Pakistan military; sweep is second phase of a broader operation against the Pakistani Taliban and allied militants in North Waziristan.

byline.contributor: Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud and Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: After two weeks of air and artillery strikes during which over 500,000 people fled the area, soldiers moved into a town in North Waziristan.

headline.main: Pakistani Forces Begin Assault on Militant Strongholds
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Forces Begin Assault on Militant Strongholds
